DOC.detailed_description: A majority > 1 million people require life support intensive care unit ( ICU ) survive . As survival improve however , grow number suffer subsequent physical disability , also persistent symptom depression , anxiety , post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) . Few intervention address ICU survivor ' psychological distress . Fewer still address physical , geographical , logistical barrier receive post-discharge support medically ill population encounter . Consequently , population suffers unmet need great public health importance . Mindfulness adaptable self-regulation practice alleviate psychological distress symptom use variety meditative technique , typically taught face-to face month . As extension standard mindfulness practice , investigator develop telephone-/web-delivered mobile mindfulness-based training ( mMBT ) system inform ICU survivor ' input could address medically ill patient ' delivery barrier . The investigator ' recent pilot study demonstrate early support mMBT 's feasibility acceptability , enhance content electronic patient-reported outcome capability . The investigator ' early work mMBT , promising , identify key knowledge gap population target , plausible range psychological distress estimate relevant study design , assurance acceptability must address definitive clinical trial conduct . Therefore , study team propose 2-year pilot study 90 ICU survivor randomize education control , 'standard ' telephone session mMBT , self-directed / app-based mMBT . A mixed method approach use determine treatment effect .
